title: jpog54
author: jpog54
created_time: February 28, 2023, 02:23:39 AMLast edit: March 11, 2023, 12:59:26 AM by jpog54
content: Currently looking for web development work. I'm a full stack engineer with 2 years of experience around web development, whether that be front end or back end.Recently I have mostly done contract work on shopify and wix from scratchLet me know if you need anything done, the specifications and we can go from there  Past work: https://www.headstashdelivered.com/https://www.cannabisnorthcounty.com/https://www.amandasfinejewels.com/Languages I'm proficient in:HTMLCSSJavascriptJavaPHPSQL

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: jpog54 on February 28, 2023, 02:23:39 AMI'm a full stack engineer with 2 years of experience around web development, whether that be front end or back end.As you have 2 years of experience you have a good number of portfolios. WOuld you like to share your work and experience here so that the potential buyer can review your projects/samples and work with you if they are interested after reviewing your project/sample? I do not think there is any chance to get a job without previous work experience.

comments.author: virasog
comments.body: Quote from: jpog54 on February 28, 2023, 02:23:39 AMCurrently looking for web development work. I'm a full stack engineer with 2 years of experience around web development, whether that be front end or back end.Recently I have mostly done contract work on shopify and wix from scratchLet me know if you need anything done, the specifications and we can go from there  By looking at your work, you seem to be a good developer. Why don't you try your luck on freelancer websites and also offer your services at fiverr.com ?Also, i would suggest that you should have your own portfolio website as this is the need of the time to stand out among the competition.

I'll definitively put some ads there

comments.author: albon
comments.body: Quote from: jpog54 on February 28, 2023, 03:46:28 PMNot a bad idea at all. I'll definitively put some ads there It is not enough to publish service ads only on freelancer sites, you must develop a marketing plan for your services, and you must engage in communities that are specific to your field (such as web development), such as specialized groups on social media sites, forums, etc. will help you gain experience from professionals in your field and get good work opportunities. It is better, as Shasan mentioned, to create a Portfolio or a personal website that contains your previous works, and my advice to you as a former Freelancer is to deal only with trusted clients. A contract in which the terms, the agreed amount, and everything are written must be concluded.Good luck to you, and I hope you find people interested in your services here on the forum.

comments.author: ShowOff
comments.body: My advice: Try changing the title of this thread to service thread or something like that. I think also be great if you complement it with some of your work, and you just keep it on top to let the community know about what you have to offer.Remember that you are only allowed to bumping your thread once per 24 hours, and I hope you are lucky enough to get your first job on the forum.

I'm sure you can find a lot of job opportunities on Upwork with the kind of skills you got.  Full Stack Developers are always in demand in crypto projects and with just one search on Upwork you can easily find an employer.Or you can even create one project for crypto users, be part of it for your portfolio and you could get reputably recognized by the community.

comments.author: shasan
comments.body: Quote from: jpog54 on March 01, 2023, 05:28:17 PMI've exceeded my 2 messages per dayYou can increase the number of messages per day as well as posts frequently if you can buy a copper membership. As you are providing a service I recommend you buy a copper membership. Also, another thing please do not create more than one post on a single row. If you want to say more things you have to wait for a post by another person or have to edit your previous post or you have to remove your previous post and repost with new words. Never delete and post the same.

comments.body: Quote from: jpog54 on February 28, 2023, 02:23:39 AMCurrently looking for web development work. I'm a full stack engineer with 2 years of experience around web development, whether that be front end or back end.Recently I have mostly done contract work on shopify and wix from scratchLet me know if you need anything done, the specifications and we can go from there  This is a good one mate. It is ice you are marketing your skills here but I would suggest you edit Thur thread adding your portfolio as stated below bey you so one can easily see them at one upon first glance  rather than scrolling down to check for it as some investors or potential clients do not have that time of scrolling down to start looking for your portfolio and past works. Do well to put them here and also if possible tell your past clients if they are registered here to also vouch for you as they have tested your services as you claimed you have had many deals and jobs in the past. This will speak very well for you instead of much talking.And lastly, do not fail to seeking the services of an escrow for transparency and credibility if there be any client you are working who have indicated interested for you to work for them.

comments.author: 2double0
comments.body: If you wish to increase your rating on Upwork, then whenever you get a job through this forum or locally, try to ask that employer to open a job requirement on Upwork and give it to you only once you bid there. Although you will need to give some percentage from your earnings to Upwork as they charge it to allow you to bid there and get the job of your dreams, you will get a rating and once you manage to get a regular client, you will see your reputation score increase and it will bring you more jobs faster than current wait times.
